quiz_metadata.title: Orthogonality, Projections, and Least Squares Quiz
quiz_metadata.description: This quiz covers the main concepts of orthogonality, projections, and least squares from the video content.

questions.question_text: What does it mean for two vectors to be orthogonal?

options.text: They have the same direction
They have the same magnitude
They meet at a right angle (90°)
They are parallel to each other

questions.explanation: Two vectors are orthogonal if they meet at a right angle (90°), meaning their dot product is zero.

questions.question_text: What is the difference between orthogonal and orthonormal vectors?

options.text: Orthogonal vectors have the same magnitude, while orthonormal vectors do not
Orthogonal vectors meet at a right angle, while orthonormal vectors are parallel
Orthogonal vectors meet at a right angle, while orthonormal vectors have a magnitude of 1
Orthogonal vectors have a magnitude of 1, while orthonormal vectors meet at a right angle

questions.explanation: Orthogonal vectors meet at a right angle, while orthonormal vectors meet at a right angle and have a magnitude of 1.

options.text: A matrix with orthogonal rows
A matrix with orthogonal columns
A matrix with orthonormal rows
A matrix with orthonormal columns

questions.explanation: An orthogonal matrix is a matrix with orthogonal columns, meaning each column is a vector that meets at a right angle with every other column.

questions.question_text: What is the property of an orthogonal matrix Q such that Q^T Q = I?

options.text: The transpose of Q is the inverse of Q
The inverse of Q is the transpose of Q
The determinant of Q is 1
The norm of Q is 1

questions.explanation: The property of an orthogonal matrix Q is that Q^T Q = I, which means the transpose of Q is the inverse of Q.

questions.question_text: What is the QR decomposition of a matrix A?

options.text: A = Q + R
A = Q - R
A = QR
A = Q^T R

questions.explanation: The QR decomposition of a matrix A is A = QR, where Q is an orthogonal matrix and R is an upper triangular matrix.

questions.question_text: What is the condition for a matrix A to have a QR decomposition?

options.text: The columns of A must be linearly dependent
The columns of A must be linearly independent
The rows of A must be linearly dependent
The rows of A must be linearly independent

questions.explanation: The condition for a matrix A to have a QR decomposition is that the columns of A must be linearly independent.

questions.question_text: What is the condition number of a matrix?

options.text: A measure of the sensitivity of a matrix to small changes
A measure of the stability of a matrix
A measure of the determinant of a matrix
A measure of the inverse of a matrix

questions.explanation: The condition number of a matrix is a measure of the sensitivity of a matrix to small changes.

questions.question_text: What is the ideal condition number for a matrix?
questions.explanation: The ideal condition number for a matrix is 1, which means the matrix is stable and not sensitive to small changes.
